name: Page Types
pages: Repository Pages can have many different and complex abilities, so they are categorized into three main types based on functionality:$(br2)- Type pages$(br)- Attribute pages$(br)- Action pages

pages.title: Type Pages
pages.text: A single type page is required for any book to function, as these broadly define the general behaviour of the book, and usually dictate what other pages you can use in the first place.$(br2)E.g. an $(l:arcane_repository:item_storage/type_item_storage)Item Storage Type Page$() will create a book that holds items, while an $(l:arcane_repository:indexing/type_indexing)Indexing Type Page$() will create a book to $(l:arcane_repository:indexing)index your library$().

pages: Some type pages also have variant types, which may be required as a base for action or attribute pages. For example, the Item Storage Type Page has a variant called $(l:arcane_repository:item_storage/type_block_storage)Block Storage$(), which only stores items that can be placed as blocks. This restriction however means it can be used in conjunction with a $(l:arcane_repository:item_storage/action_building)Building Action Page$() to place blocks directly from a book.
